original: kunda dung 'dra sa bon 'bar //

original: aom badzra pushpe h'um /🔽aom badzra dh'u pe h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra pushpe h'um / aom badzra dh'u pe h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra puṣpe hūṃ🔽Oṃ vajra dhūpe hūṃ

analyzed: aom badzra d'i pe h'um / @122b aom badzra gandhe h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra dīpe hūṃ🔽Oṃ vajra gandhe hūṃ

original: aom badzra nee bi dye h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra nee bi dye h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra naividya hūṃ

original: de nas / dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi //
analyzed: de nas / dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi //
translated: Then: I go for refuge to the Three Jewels

original: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags //
translated: And individually confess each nonvirtue.

original: 'gro ba'i dge la rjes yi rang //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dge la rjes yi rang //
translated: I rejoice in the virtue of beings

original: sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung //🔽sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs mchog la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung // sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs mchog la //
translated: And hold the enlightened mind of awakening.🔽Until I reach enlightenment,

original: byang chub bar du bdag skyabs mchi //
analyzed: byang chub bar du bdag skyabs mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: rang gzhan don ni rab sgrub phyir //🔽byang chub sems ni bdag gis bskyed //
analyzed: rang gzhan don ni rab sgrub phyir // byang chub sems ni bdag gis bskyed //
translated: In order to perfectly accomplish the benefit of self and other,🔽I generate the awakening mind.

original: byang chub mchog tu bdag gis sems bskyed nas //
analyzed: byang chub mchog tu bdag gis sems bskyed nas //
translated: Having generated the supreme enlightened mind,

original: sems can thams cad bdag gis mgron du gnyer //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag gis mgron du gnyer //
translated: I invite all sentient beings as my guests.

original: byang chub spyod mchog yid 'ong spyad par bgyi //
analyzed: byang chub spyod mchog yid 'ong spyad par bgyi //
translated: I will engage in the delightful conduct of awakening

original: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces pa'i smon lam sngon du 'gro ba yis //
analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces pa'i smon lam sngon du 'gro ba yis //
translated: And accomplish buddhahood for the benefit of beings.

original: chos kun bdag med sngags 'di brjod par bya //
analyzed: chos kun bdag med sngags 'di brjod par bya //
translated: One should recite this mantra of the selflessness of all phenomena:

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: sa bon sgyu ma lta bu bsam //
analyzed: sa bon sgyu ma lta bu bsam //
translated: One should visualize the seed syllable like an illusion.

original: khams gsum rnams ni ma lus pa //
analyzed: khams gsum rnams ni ma lus pa //
translated: The entire three realms

original: mthong ba dang ni reg pa nyid //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni reg pa nyid //
translated: are seen and touched

original: dper na thams cad sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: dper na thams cad sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: like everything is an illusion.

original: de bzhin dmigs pa'ang med pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin dmigs pa'ang med pa ste //
translated: Likewise, there is no object of observation,

original: kun kyang sgyu ma ji bzhin no //
analyzed: kun kyang sgyu ma ji bzhin no //
translated: and everything is like an illusion.

original: 'gro ba thams cad gnas pa ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad gnas pa ni //
translated: The abode of all migrating beings

original: de yang dmigs pa med par bya //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa med par bya //
translated: should also be made free of observation.

original: zhes pas lhag par mos par bya //
analyzed: zhes pas lhag par mos par bya //
translated: Thus one should have superior devotion.

original: de nas thog ma med pa'i dus kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon spangs nas rang bzhin gyis dag pa zhes bya ba lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thog ma med pa'i dus kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon spangs nas rang bzhin gyis dag pa zhes bya ba lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: Then, having abandoned the seed of unreal imagination from beginningless time, one should have superior devotion to what is called “natural purity.”

original: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ.

original: zhes so // de nas sngon du gsungs pa'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las ral gri'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de nas sngon du gsungs pa'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las ral gri'o //
translated: Then, from the transformation of the seed previously mentioned, there is a sword.

original: de'i chang pa'i dbus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i chang pa'i dbus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: In the middle of its hilt is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du sngon du gsungs pa'i sa bon /
analyzed: de'i steng du sngon du gsungs pa'i sa bon /
translated: Upon that is the seed previously mentioned.

original: de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las 'jam dpal gyi skur bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las 'jam dpal gyi skur bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: All of that is transformed into the body of Mañjuśrī, which is oneself.

original: bdag nyid 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: One should think of oneself as the chief of all migrating beings.

original: padma dang zla ba'i gdan la sems dpa'i skyil krung gis mnyam par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: padma dang zla ba'i gdan la sems dpa'i skyil krung gis mnyam par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: One sits in the cross-legged sattva posture on a seat of lotus and moon.

original: zla ba du ma'i 'od zer 'phro zhing nam mkha'i mthil khyab par mdzad pa sna tshogs pa'i na bza' bsnams shing /
analyzed: zla ba du ma'i 'od zer 'phro zhing nam mkha'i mthil khyab par mdzad pa sna tshogs pa'i na bza' bsnams shing /
translated: One radiates light rays from many moons, pervading the surface of the sky. One wears various garments.

original: 'gro ba rnams dga' bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams dga' bar mdzad pa /
translated: One delights migrating beings.

original: gzugs mdzes shing sku mdog dkar po yid du 'ong ba'i zur phud lngas spras pa'i dpa'i bo chen po rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: gzugs mdzes shing sku mdog dkar po yid du 'ong ba'i zur phud lngas spras pa'i dpa'i bo chen po rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: One has a beautiful form, a white body, and is adorned with five locks of hair. One is a great hero adorned with all ornaments.

original: phyag g-yas pa na ral gri 'phyar ba /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa na ral gri 'phyar ba /
translated: In one’s right hand one brandishes a sword.

original: phyag g-yon gyi thugs kar po ti bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi thugs kar po ti bsnams pa'o //
translated: In his left hand, at his heart, he holds a book.

original: de nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should bind the seal.

original: lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar te /
translated: One should join the palms together,

original: mdzub mo dag dang ming med dag gis sen @123a * //
analyzed: mdzub mo dag dang ming med dag gis sen @123a * //
translated: and with the index fingers and little fingers

original: mo dag bkab nas autpal kha bye ba ltar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mo dag bkab nas autpal kha bye ba ltar gnas pa'o //
translated: one should cover the nails, and [the hands] should remain like an open utpala flower.

original: snying ga dang / mdzod spu dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bo rnams su rang gi sngags kyis dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga dang / mdzod spu dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bo rnams su rang gi sngags kyis dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should place one's mantra at the heart, the ūrṇā, the throat, and the crown.

original: phyi nas lte ba'i 'og tu bhr'um yig dkar po aa shvadth'a'i lo ma lta bu bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas lte ba'i 'og tu bhr'um yig dkar po aa shvadth'a'i lo ma lta bu bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then below the navel one should imagine a white bhruṃ syllable like an aśva-ttha leaf.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la de'i steng du brgyad pa'i bzhi pa dang po'i bcu drug pa bdun pa'i gnyis pa dang po'i bzhi pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la de'i steng du brgyad pa'i bzhi pa dang po'i bcu drug pa bdun pa'i gnyis pa dang po'i bzhi pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: On a moon disk, above that, the fourth of the eighth [vowel] is adorned with the first [vowel] and the sixteenth, the second of the seventh [vowel] and the first [vowel], and the fourth.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las padma kha zum pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las padma kha zum pa ste /
translated: That completely transforms into a closed lotus.

original: lte ba'i steng du h'um yig kha 'byed pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i steng du h'um yig kha 'byed pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine a hūṃ syllable opening above the navel.

original: de'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Above that, a moon disk.

original: de'i steng du sor gcig tsam spangs nas 'khor lo rtsibs drug pa 'od zer dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du sor gcig tsam spangs nas 'khor lo rtsibs drug pa 'od zer dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Above that, having left off about one finger-width, [there is] a six-spoked wheel with light-rays.

original: de'i rtsibs rnams la dbyangs yig bcu gnyis yi ge zung re re dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rtsibs rnams la dbyangs yig bcu gnyis yi ge zung re re dgod par bya'o //
translated: On its spokes, one should arrange the twelve vowels in pairs.

original: rtsibs so so'i steng du rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge re re rnam par bkod nas 'khor lo'i nang gi lte ba la dh'i:yig 'od zer dang bcas pa mi g-yo bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsibs so so'i steng du rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge re re rnam par bkod nas 'khor lo'i nang gi lte ba la dh'i:yig 'od zer dang bcas pa mi g-yo bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having arranged each syllable of the root mantra on each spoke, one should meditate on the syllable DHĪḤ in the center of the wheel, together with light-rays, without moving.

original: phyi'i mu khyud la k'a li sbyor ba yang dag par 'bar ba'i nga nya na na ma'i yi ge rnams spangs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i mu khyud la k'a li sbyor ba yang dag par 'bar ba'i nga nya na na ma'i yi ge rnams spangs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On the outer rim, one should meditate on the arrangement of the alphabet, omitting the letters KA, ĻA, ṢA, ŅA, and NA, blazing with light.

original: yang de'i steng du sor gcig tsam spangs nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la de'i steng du aa ra pa tsa na zhes pa bltas nas shin tu myur du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de'i steng du sor gcig tsam spangs nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la de'i steng du aa ra pa tsa na zhes pa bltas nas shin tu myur du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Above that, having left off about one finger-width, on a moon-disc, one should meditate on the wheel of the syllable A Ra Pa Tza Na, looking at it and revolving very quickly.

original: ji srid zla ba drug gi bar du sngags 'di bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid zla ba drug gi bar du sngags 'di bzlas par bya'o //
translated: For as long as six months, one should recite this mantra.

original: aom badzrat'ikshna mu:zhes nyi ma re re la khri phrag re bzlas par bya'o //🔽de nas lkugs pa yin yang dag gi dbang por 'gyur zhing blo dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom badzrat'ikshna mu:zhes nyi ma re re la khri phrag re bzlas par bya'o // de nas lkugs pa yin yang dag gi dbang por 'gyur zhing blo dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should recite Oṃ vajra-tīkṣṇa muḥ ten thousand times each day.

original: gzhung stong phrag re 'dzin nus so //
analyzed: gzhung stong phrag re 'dzin nus so //
translated: Then, even if one is mute, one will become eloquent, intelligent, and able to memorize a thousand texts.

original: rgyun chad med par legs par sbyar ba'i skad dang ldan zhing snyan ngag mkhan chen por gyur nas bstan bcos thams cad kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun chad med par legs par sbyar ba'i skad dang ldan zhing snyan ngag mkhan chen por gyur nas bstan bcos thams cad kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a great poet, speaking fluently and eloquently, and will master all treatises.

original: grub par 'gyur nas ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bdag por 'gyur zhing rig 'dzin ma rnams dang lhan cig tu rtse bar byed do //
analyzed: grub par 'gyur nas ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bdag por 'gyur zhing rig 'dzin ma rnams dang lhan cig tu rtse bar byed do //
translated: Having attained accomplishment, one will become the lord of the vidyādharas of the sword and will play with the vidyādhara women.

original: 'khor lo mchog 'dir mi gsal ba rnams slob dpon gyi man ngag las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo mchog 'dir mi gsal ba rnams slob dpon gyi man ngag las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: What is not clear in this supreme wheel should be understood from the master's instructions.

original: shes rab 'khor lo'i mchog gyur 'di //
analyzed: shes rab 'khor lo'i mchog gyur 'di //
translated: This supreme wheel of wisdom,

original: bris pa'i 'bras bu gang thob pa //
analyzed: bris pa'i 'bras bu gang thob pa //
translated: whatever fruit is obtained by writing it,🔽by that, in this world,

original: de yis 'jig rten thams cad 'dir //
analyzed: de yis 'jig rten thams cad 'dir //
translated: all beings will attain the supreme.

original: 'jam dpal go 'phang thob par shog / mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i man ngag shes rab 'khor lo'i dngos grub mchog gi sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'jam dpal go 'phang thob par shog / mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i man ngag shes rab 'khor lo'i dngos grub mchog gi sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: This is the complete method for accomplishing the supreme siddhi of the wisdom chakra, the oral instruction of the recitation of the names.
